meta_description: Admission to the Springfield Museums covers five world-class museums of art, history, science, and Dr. Seuss.
hours_text: Opens January 24 Thursdays @ 12:15 pm NOw available across Massachusetts
admission_text:
## **Advance tickets recommended!  
**

The Welcome Center is the gateway to awe, discovery, and playful learning at the Springfield Museums, home of the Amazing World of Dr. Seuss Museum! To help ensure moving quickly through the Welcome Center admission line, we recommend purchasing your tickets in advance.

[Buy Tickets Now](http://56082.blackbaudhosting.com/56082/tickets?tab=3&txobjid=12b93743-c39c-49a8-ae9e-17ee96d8bcae)

_Please note that discount offers can only be applied**in person** on the day of your visit_ _.  
_**Questions?** [413-314-6436](tel:413-314-6436) or [welcomecenter@springfieldmuseums.org](mailto:welcomecenter@springfieldmuseums.org). Messages answered during regular museum hours.

## Springfield Residents & Walkups

Walk up tickets (including Springfield Access) are available each day at the Welcome Center.

## Groups

Group access (10+ visitors) to the Springfield Museums is available by reservation only and should be made at least four weeks in advance. 

[Group Tour Reservations](https://springfieldmuseums.org/groups/tours-and-discounts/)

## Exchanges and Cancellations

Tickets are nonrefundable, but exchanges for another date may be issued under certain conditions.

### For more information on planning your visit to the Springfield Museums,  
please visit our [Hours & Admissions](https://springfieldmuseums.org/hours-and-admission/) and [Visitor Policies & Tips](https://springfieldmuseums.org/hours-and-admission/visitor-tips-policies/) pages.

accessibility_text:
## Accessibility Statement for Springfield Museums Website

This is an accessibility statement from Springfield Museums.

### Measures to support accessibility

Springfield Museums takes the following measures to ensure accessibility of Springfield Museums Website:

  * Provide continual accessibility training for our staff.
  * Assign clear accessibility goals and responsibilities.
  * Employ formal accessibility quality assurance methods.

### Conformance status

The [Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)](https://www.w3.org/WAI/standards-guidelines/wcag/) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. Springfield Museums Website is partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA. Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard.

### Feedback

We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of Springfield Museums Website. Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers on Springfield Museums Website:

  * Phone: 413-263-6800
  * E-mail: [info@springfieldmuseums.org](https://mail.google.com/mail/?view=cm&fs=1&tf=1&to=info@springfieldmuseums.orginfo@springfieldmuseums.org)
  * Visitor Address: 21 Edwards Street Springfield, MA 01103

We try to respond to feedback within 2 business days.

### Technical specifications
